objdescid.origination: Anonymousdelineator. The reference to Judges, lower right of the design, might be by Blake. The quotation from the Bible lower on the leaf is not by Blake. The identity of the calligrapher who wrote the quotation from the Bible is not known.
objdescid.compdate: c. 1800-03This work was probably delivered to Butts between the summer of 1803 and May 1805 (Bentley, *Records*, page 764), but has generally been dated to an earlier period, c. 1800-03, for stylistic reasons; see Butlin 455.

objinfo.medium: pencil, pen and ink, and water color

provenance.name: Philadelphia Museum of Art
provenance.note: Commissioned, perhaps as early as 1800, and acquired, by 1805, from Blake by Thomas Butts; by inheritance in 1845 to Thomas Butts, Jr.; by inheritance in 1862 to Captain F. J. Butts; offered Sotheby's, 24 June 1903, lot 6 (£50 to "Knowles," but apparently not sold and returned to Butts); the widow of F. J. Butts, sold April 1906 through Carfax & Co. to W. Graham Robertson; sold Christie's, 22 July 1949, lot 13 (£861 to the dealer Thomas Agnew & Sons); David Eccles; sold Nov. 1956 by Agnew's through the dealer Charles Sessler to Mrs. William T. Tonner ($4,435); bequeathed by Tonner in 1964 to the Philadelphia Museum of Art, which received the work in 1972.

repository.addressline: 26th Street and the Benjamin Franklin Parkway

desc.objtitle: Samson Subdued, full view including inscriptions

objnote.p: The reference to Judges, lower right of the design, might be by Blake. The quotation from the Bible lower on the leaf is not by Blake. The identity of the calligrapher who wrote the quotation from the Bible is not known.

The reference to Judges, lower right of the design, might be by Blake. The quotation from the Bible lower on the leaf is not by Blake. The identity of the calligrapher who wrote the quotation from the Bible is not known.

lg.l: And she made him sleep on her knees and she called for a man, and she caused
him to shave off the seven locks of his head.
